meanings.sent1: She prevised the outcome of the experiment before starting.
meanings.sent2: He always prevised potential problems to avoid last-minute issues.
meanings.sent3: The students prevised the surprise test and were well-prepared.
meanings.sent4: Her intuition prevised the danger lurking in the shadows.
meanings.sent5: The wise old owl prevised the storm and sought shelter in time.

meanings.definition: To envision or plan in advance.
meanings.sent1: They prevised a successful marketing strategy for the new product.
meanings.sent2: The architect prevised the building's design before construction began.
meanings.sent3: The children prevised a fun-filled day at the amusement park.
meanings.sent4: His dream prevised a future full of possibilities and opportunities.
meanings.sent5: The chef prevised a delicious menu for the special event.
